text: 1991 Action Plan
label: H4

text: * THAILAND DEVELOPMENT GOALS
label: HH1

text: * Sustained Economic Growth
label: H4

text: -Maintain annual economic growth at 9%
label: H4

text: * Broaden the Benefits of Economic Growth
label: H4

text: - Create new jobs and increase incomes
label: H4

text: * Manage the Environment
label: H4

text: - Improve the quality of life and
label: H4

text: - Preserve the environment
label: H4

text: * USAID RESPONSE
label: H4

text: - Human Capital and Technology
label: H4

text: - Environment
label: H4

text: -Private Sector Development
label: H4

text: -Financial Markets
label: H4

text: HUMAN CAPITAL
label: H4

text: Development Problem:
label: BODY

text: Mismatch between large pool of unskilled rural labor with only sixth
label: H4

text: grade education and the work force needs of the booming modern
label: BODY

text: industrial and service sectors.
label: BODY

text: Critical shortages of skilled personnel in areas of engine*, ing, scientific
label: H4

text: and technical disciplines, e.g., petrochemicals, polymers, information
label: BODY

text: technology, and business management.
label: BODY

text: Limited linkages between high quality university research capability.
label: H4

text: and private sector needs for more technology-intensive products.
label: BODY

text: Low private investment in research and development
label: H4

text: USAID Response;
label: BODY

text: U.S.-Thai university linkages in key engineering, technical and business
label: H4

text: sectors, to meet current and future Thai skill needs in technical and
label: BODY

text: managerial disciplines.
label: BODY

text: Cooperative education programs involving Thai students in U.S.
label: H4

text: businesses in the U.S. and Thailand; private and public sector initiatives
label: BODY

text: to upgrade the labor force.
label: BODY

text: Cooperative work-study programs involving U.S. or Thai universities or
label: H4

text: secondary schools and U.S. or Thai private sector firms or industrial
label: BODY

text: associations, e.g. machine tools.
label: BODY

text: Support for STDB's legal establishment as a sustainable institution
label: H4

text: encouraging the commercialization of technology in Thailand.
label: BODY

text: U.S-Thai business collaboration promoted through cooperation with the
label: H4

text: State of Maryland, ASACI and Joint U.S.-Thai business organization/ '
label: BODY

text: ENVIRONMENT
label: H4

text: Development Problem;
label: BODY

text: Depletion of natural resource base: water, forests, fish, biodiversity.
label: H4

text: Environmental degradation, particularly in urban, industrial and tourist
label: H4

text: areas: air and water pollution; solid, toxic and hazardous waste disposal
label: BODY

text: problems.
label: BODY

text: Low public awareness of environmental issues and inadequate policy,
label: H4

text: legal arid institutional structure for addressing them.
label: BODY

text: RTG has thus designated environmental action as one of three goals
label: H4

text: under 7th 5-Year Plan.
label: BODY

text: USAID Response:
label: BODY

text: Generate and disseminate information to educate the public and
label: BODY

text: RTG on critical environment/natural resource (ENR) issues relating
label: BODY

text: to urban, industrial and tourism growth and biodiversity
label: BODY

text: conservation, e.g. TV series sponsored by FTI.
label: BODY

text: Assist RTG to formulate and implement policies and regulations
label: BODY

text: particularly re air and water pollution, e.g. TDRI/HIID policy
label: BODY

text: program, that led to adoption of "Polluter Must Pay" principle.
label: BODY

text: Strengthen RTG staff capability .(including provincial/municipal
label: BODY

text: staff) to analyze and address ENR issues
label: BODY

text: In selected tourist/industrial sites, assist local authorities and private
label: BODY

text: firms to install appropriate environmental infrastructure and
label: BODY

text: provide needed services in solid waste disposal systems, waste water
label: BODY

text: treatment, hazardous waste control systems.
label: BODY

text: FACILITATING PRIVATE SECTOR CONTRIBUTIONS
label: H4

text: TO GROWTH WITH EQUITY
label: H4

text: Development Problem;
label: BODY

text: - Despite rapid economic growth emanating largely from the modern
label: H4

text: industrial and service sectors, more than half the Thai labor force still
label: BODY

text: derives its income from traditional agriculture. As a result, agricultural
label: BODY

text: labor productivity is low and income disparities are widening, even while
label: BODY

text: skilled and semi-skilled labor shortages hamper industrial/service
label: BODY

text: competitiveness in the world economy.
label: BODY

text: - Overly centralized political and economic decbion-making processes do
label: H4

text: not adequately reflect the views of rural farmers, urban labor or other
label: BODY

text: largely disfranchised groups. Moreover, the political system lacks
label: BODY

text: strong democratic institutions to balance the power of vested interests
label: BODY

text: over the longer term.
label: BODY

text: US AID Response:
label: BODY

text: - Facilitate U.S. investment in Thailand to create jobs, expand income
label: H4

text: opportunities (particularly outside Bangkok) and address continuing
label: BODY

text: * development problems, e.g. environmental infrastructure, and
label: BODY

text: opportunities, e.g. agribusiness. (JUST Business, ASACI, Maryland, etc.)
label: BODY

text: --. Through U.S. PVOs, strengthen institutional capacity of elected national
label: BODY

text: and local government to participate effectively in public policy debate,
label: BODY

text: e.g., TAP grant.
label: BODY

text: ~ Through U.S. PVOs, increase the institutional, analytical and
label: BODY

text: communication capabilities of private advocacy groups, particularly
label: BODY

text: those representative of environmental, and democratic interests,
label: BODY

text: e.g., PACT, AAFLI, and those addressing the AIDs epidemic, e.g. PATH,
label: BODY

text: PDA.
label: BODY

text: FINANCIAL MARKETS AND INFRASTRUCTURE FINANCE
label: H4

text: Development Problem;
label: BODY

text: - Massive shortfall of power, telecommunications, transport and
label: H4

text: environmental infrastructure requires substantial private investment
label: BODY

text: in light of continuing cap on foreign public borrowing.
label: BODY

text: - Lack of long-term debt instruments, particularly at the municipal level, to
label: H4

text: mobilize investment for infrastructure.
label: BODY

text: - Stock Exchange of Thailand (SET) has limited ability to manage
label: H4

text: transaction clearances and settlements, share registration and
label: BODY

text: self-regulation, and limited product line (no bonds or futures markets).
label: BODY

text: USA1D Response:
label: BODY

text: - Municipal/provincial environmental infrastructure projects identified,
label: H4

text: facilitated by USAID with involvement by U.S. A&E firms, equipment
label: BODY

text: manufacturers and investment bankers, e.g. waste management, waste
label: BODY

text: water treatment, hazardous waste control
label: BODY

text: - Assistance to RTG by U.S. investment firms for management of funds
label: H4

text: generated under recently enacted Social Security legislation.
label: BODY

text: - Several small privatizations with U.S. investment bankers involved in
label: H4

text: managing the financial package.
label: BODY

text: - Bond issue underwritten by U.S. investment bankers, e.g. for power sector
label: H4

text: investments.
label: BODY

text: .-- Linkages between SET and U.S. exchanges, e.g. New York Stock
label: BODY

text: Exchange and Chicago Board of Trade, to improve SET efficiency,
label: H4

text: expand product line to include futures markets.
label: BODY

text: - Linkages between U.S. and Thai organizations to upgrade skills of Thai
label: H4

text: investment professionals, e.g., Chartered Financial Analyst Program:
label: BODY

text: PARTNERSHIP AND TRANSACTIONS
label: HH1

text: * PARTNERSHIP The approach will be to identify Thai
label: H4

text: development problems and issues, then seek solutions with
label: H4

text: U.S. expertise, know-how, technology, private sector services
label: H4

text: and investment.
label: H4

text: * TRANSACTIONS The focus will be on outcomes in each
label: H4

text: area of emphasis--human capital and technology,
label: H4

text: environment, private sector development and financial
label: H4

text: markets. USAID will seek to structure a limited number of
label: H4

text: transactions that address the issues or problems in a way
label: H4

text: that builds synergism among USAID programs.
label: H4

text: TRANSACTIONS
label: H4

text: CRITERIA
label: H4

text: SEEK AND MATCH—Identify Thai problems and issues
label: H4

text: where U.S. has expertise and comparative advantage.
label: H4

text: ACCESS—Seek a specific solution among a broad array of
label: H4

text: U.S. interests; induce competition.
label: H4

text: LEVERAGE—Insist on a multiple of USAID funds. A $ 1 of
label: H4

text: USAID funds should generate significant additional monies.
label: H4

text: SUSTAINABILITY—Identify cost sharing, fees, and revenue
label: H4

text: streams early on. USAID is the catalyst, not the financier.
label: H4

text: PERFORMANCE CONTRACTING—Charge contractors with
label: H4

text: outcomes: deals, transactions and agreements. Not reports.
label: H4

text: HUMAN CAPITAL AND TECHNOLOGY
label: H4

text: ** Oudaiojgkorn College of Petroleum Chemistry and Polymers
label: H4

text: The Chulalongkorn University Petrochemical College envisions a
label: BODY

text: collaborative effort with American universities to create a Southeast Asian
label: BODY

text: program of excellence in polymer sciences and petrochemistry. The college
label: BODY

text: would produce about 40 graduate MSc. degrees per year, of which one third
label: BODY

text: would be from other southeast asian countries. The program will bz
label: H4

text: self-supporting based on a high tuition, university budgets and petroleum and
label: BODY

text: polymer industry participation. U.S. based petroleum and chemical
label: BODY

text: companies are expected to support the College for their manpower needs,
label: BODY

text: research and development, as well as a setting in which to showcase their
label: BODY

text: products. The University is currently investing $4.2 million for construction
label: BODY

text: of a building to house the college.
label: BODY

text: ** Association for Manufacturing Technology
label: BODY

text: Rapid growth of manufacturing in Thailand has generated strong
label: BODY

text: demand for machine tools and qualified labor to support this growth. U.S.
label: BODY

text: machine tool technology is highly valued but U.S. market share is low despite
label: BODY

text: competitive prices and good products. The U.S. Association for
label: BODY

text: Manufacturing Technology has been actively seeking ways to increase the
label: BODY

text: U.S. market share and is developing a program proposal which would
label: BODY

text: acquaint and train Thais on U.S. machine tools and controls and position U.S.
label: BODY

text: companies to participate in this fast-growing sector. U.S. firms have already
label: BODY

text: pledged the donation of high-value equipment and training in a joint program
label: H4

text: with Thai training institutes. Tuition and industry contributions would make
label: BODY

text: the program sustainable.
label: BODY

text: ,,J k
label: H4

text: ** Cooperative Education Program
label: BODY

text: Thailand's higher educational system needs to produce a highly qualified
label: BODY

text: labor force to meet the needs of the economy but much of the training is too
label: H4

text: academic, especially in technical and engineering fields. Cooperative
label: BODY

text: education opportunities to help bridge this gap are limited in Thailand.
label: BODY

text: Northeastern University, with a long record of successful cooperative
label: BODY

text: education programs, wishes to establish a pilot program which would allow
label: BODY

text: up to 20 Thai students in the United States to undertake an internship (for
label: BODY

text: academic credit) with American companies with operations in Thailand. The
label: BODY

text: program addresses a need for a responsive work force and stronger,
label: BODY

text: sustainable ties to U.S. academic institutions and companies active in the
label: BODY

text: regional economy. U.S. businesses in Thailand are particularly interested in
label: BODY

text: this program to help meet skills needs and are willing to bear the costs for the
label: BODY

text: internships. The program could be expanded to include more U.S. and Thai
label: BODY

text: universities. USAID assistance would help with costs of administering the
label: BODY

text: pilot program, including matching of students and employers and program
label: BODY

text: evaluation.
label: BODY

text: ** Information Technology Center (JTO at Chulalongkorn University
label: BODY

text: The ITC will grant undergraduate and graduate degrees in computer science
label: BODY

text: and information technology. In support of this program, the university is
label: BODY

text: investing in a campus wide computer network and a new, building to house
label: BODY

text: the Center. The project will use the optimal mix of English and Thai
label: BODY

text: instruction and there are plans to expand the network to most of the Thai
label: BODY

text: universities. Long-term collaboration with U.S. universities for curriculum
label: BODY

text: development, exchange of faculties, and innovative technologies for distance
label: BODY

text: education is desired. There is significant interest among U.S. computer
label: BODY

text: companies in contributing to this program. USAID contributions-could funcl
label: BODY

text: exposure of key staff to state of the art U.S. technology and explore further
label: BODY

text: ways to facilitate sustainable links to U.S. universities and industries. .
label: BODY

text: ** Process and Quality Control Center at a Private University
label: BODY

text: U.S. manufacturers need a mechanism to upgrade the statistical quality
label: BODY

text: control of Thai component manufacturers. The upgrading should focus on
label: BODY

text: general elements of statistical process control and total quality control but
label: BODY

text: may include custom, company-specific consulting and certification
label: BODY

text: procedures. U.S. universities, including the University of Detroit and the
label: BODY

text: Milwaukee School of Engineering (MSOE), have expressed interest in a
label: BODY

text: collaborative program in Thailand with one or more private universities.
label: BODY

text: Such a program could include cooperation with a local vocational school to
label: BODY

text: upgrade both the management and the work force of companies that wish to
label: H4

text: improve their Total Quality Control. Potential Thai partner institutions
label: BODY

text: include Assumption, Rangsit, or the Thai Chamber of Commerce
label: BODY

text: Universities. Such a program would be run on a self-sustaining basis with a
label: BODY

text: strong base of participation by Thai and U.S. industries. USAID funds could
label: BODY

text: help with the development costs to design curricula, plan for U.S. faculty
label: BODY

text: participation, and solicit support from private industry.
label: BODY

text: ** Certification Program in Production god Inventory Control
label: BODY

text: Related to the area of statistical process and total quality control is the
label: BODY

text: demand for stronger capabilities of small and medium manufacturers to plan
label: BODY

text: and manage the production process. This is especially important for
label: BODY

text: suppliers which produce components for industries and must meet stringent
label: BODY

text: demands for quality and delivery times. The American Production and
label: BODY

text: Inventory Control Society (APICS) provides training and certification in the
label: BODY

text: key areas of production planning and management. APICS training
label: BODY

text: materials (books, videos, interactive computer software) are available to
label: BODY

text: conduct qualified training programs in Thailand. The testing and
label: BODY

text: certification process provides a known standard of capability which is •••*•
label: BODY

text: broadly recognized by training institutes and industry.
label: BODY

text: Such a program could be managed by APICS certified staff in collaboration
label: BODY

text: with private industries and o local private university which offers an
label: BODY

text: industrial engineering degree. The program would be established as a
label: BODY

text: for-profit business, would fill an important need of industry, and would link
label: BODY

text: the university and industry in a sustainable partnership with an American
label: BODY

text: professional association. USA1D assistance could help with the start-up costs
label: BODY

text: of exchange visits and purchase of some of the course materials.
label: H4

text: ** Other Initiatives
label: BODY

text: Telecommunications is undergoing phenomenal growth and at least one
label: BODY

text: U.S. company is poised to provide training required to support the rapid
label: BODY

text: expansion of telephone infrastructure. USAID is looking at ways to facilitate
label: BODY

text: or complement this training, as an area of strong comparative advantage and
label: BODY

text: with liokages to substantial future investment*; in the sector. Most
label: BODY

text: employment opportunities created will be for outside plant technicians, who
label: BODY

text: will be recruited from the ranks of low-skilled workers and provided with
label: BODY

text: high quality technical training.
label: BODY

text: Numerous industry and educational initiatives are centered on areas
label: BODY

text: outside of the Bangkok Metropolitan Area. For example, training which
label: BODY

text: would facilitate the transfer of U.S. technology in controlled atmosphere
label: BODY

text: processing and packaging for agricultural products to extend shelf life could
label: BODY

text: stimulate increased trade and investment for fresh produce exports and
label: BODY

text: provide new employment opportunities. USAID support for human capital
label: BODY

text: elements in these initiatives could provide a further stimulus to more
label: BODY

text: multipolar development and bring benefits to rural areas which have not
label: BODY

text: shared equitably in the economic expansion.
label: BODY

text: ENVIRONMENT
label: H4

text: ** Chao Phrya River Cleanup
label: BODY

text: The Chai Pattana Foundation (H.M. the King's Development Foundation) has
label: BODY

text: committed the prestige of the Royal Family to environment, through a
label: BODY

text: campaign to clean-up the country's primary river. This will entail a
label: BODY

text: multi-million dollar long term effort to deal with urban sewerage and
label: BODY

text: industrial waste. The investment in waste water treatment alone is estimated
label: BODY

text: to be a billion dollars over an eight to ten year period. The King's
label: BODY

text: Foundation has asked for short-term assistance to carry out a thorough
label: BODY

text: review of current Thai programs and international experience in waste water
label: BODY

text: treatment and river clean-up and to help formulate policy, regulatory,
label: BODY

text: technical, and administrative recommendations which will will set the pattern
label: BODY

text: for water quality, not just for Bangkok, but for the entire nation. We are also
label: BODY

text: being asked to arrange a tour for H.R.H. Crown Princess Sirindthorn, senior
label: BODY

text: government and private sector leaders to visit the United States and see first
label: BODY

text: hand rivers that have been cleaned up successfully. The short term technical
label: BODY

text: assistance and the tour by the Princess and prominent public and private
label: BODY

text: sector leaders is an excellent opportunity to influence major decisions that
label: BODY

text: will result in the application of U.S technology, business opportunities for
label: BODY

text: equipment manufacturers and the demand for U.S. consulting services.
label: BODY

text: +* Hazardous and Toxic Waste Disposal -
label: BODY

text: The National Environment Board (NEB), following from its TDP-funded
label: BODY

text: "National Hazardous Wastes Management Strategy" (1989), has received
label: BODY

text: MANRES support to work with other concerned agencies to prepare a
label: BODY

text: National Action Plan for Hazardous Wastes Management.
label: BODY

text: _j k
label: BODY

text: The Ministry of Industry, following through on previously agreed
label: BODY

text: priorities consistent with the NEB's National Action Plan, is ready to
label: BODY

text: proceed with design of four industrial waste water treatment centers and
label: H4

text: four industrial hazardous waste treatment and disposal centers - all to
label: H4

text: be under private operators and sustained on n fee-based system. The
label: BODY

text: World Bank is providing a $700,000 grant for design of a couple of the
label: BODY

text: waste water centers and the Japanese have been approached to provide
label: BODY

text: financing for another. We have been asked to consider assisting with the
label: BODY

text: design of one or more of the industrial wast® water or hazardous waste !
label: H4

text: centers. This will be an opportunity to orient designs toward UJS.
label: BODY

text: technology and open up investment opportunities in an area where the
label: BODY

text: U.S. has considerable experience and expertise.
label: BODY

text: ** Provincial Cities Environmental Initiatives
label: BODY

text: As a result of the World Bank's Regional Cities Project, some 35 urban
label: BODY

text: infrastructure projects have been identified. Both the Department of
label: BODY

text: Local Administration and World Bank are seeking USAID support for
label: BODY

text: the design of six solid waste or waste water treatment facilities. The
label: BODY

text: investment costs could approach 50 to 75 million dollars. This will be an
label: BODY

text: opportunity to influence the design of facilities that will use U.S.
label: BODY

text: technology and equipment. Since the facilities are to be privately
label: BODY

text: operated and sustained on a fee basis, it will result in attractive
label: BODY

text: opportunities for U.S. investors.
label: BODY

text: ** federation of Thai Industries (FIT)
label: BODY

text: USAID is helping FTI to, inter alia, establish a base of technical information
label: BODY

text: regarding American technologies and technical services for industrial
label: BODY

text: environmental management and to stimulate the production of joint-venture
label: BODY

text: pollution-control industries in Thailand to serve the Southeast Asia region.
label: BODY

text: Under a planned agreement with the World Environment Center (WEC),
label: BODY

text: major U.S. manufacturing companies will work with Tuai industries to share
label: BODY

text: expertise and technology.
label: BODY

text: These linkages between U.S. industries and their Thai counterparts will
label: BODY

text: hopefully result in joint-ventures and other investment opportunities as well
label: BODY

text: as the sale of U.S. equipment and material.
label: BODY

text: ** US.-Thai Energy Conservation
label: H4

text: In January, 1990 the RTG National Energy Administration (NEA) developed
label: BODY

text: an energy conservation plan for the industrial, commercial, and residential
label: BODY

text: sectors. NEA expects that the National Energy Conservation Act will be
label: BODY

text: passed in a few weeks by the new Thai Government. The Act calls for the
label: BODY

text: establishment of testing facilities for materials and equipment, research and
label: BODY

text: development, training of technical staff for energy auditing and enforcement
label: BODY

text: of building codes, procuring software and hardware for use in program
label: H4

text: planning, and design of conservation incentive schemes. NEA has asked
label: BODY

text: USAID to provide one to two person-months of technical assistance to develop
label: BODY

text: a 3-5 year action plan, as well as recommend a U.S. entity to assist NEA with
label: BODY

text: planning and implementation of the Act. NEA has $10 million earmarked for
label: BODY

text: procurement of expert services to contract with a U.S. organization such as.
label: BODY

text: the Tennessee Val!ey Authority or the California Energy Commission.
label: BODY

text: FINANCIAL MARKETS DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM
label: H4

text: ** Chartered Financial Analyst Program
label: BODY

text: The members of the Stock Exchange of Thailand recognizing that the quality
label: BODY

text: of information and the ethical standards of financial analysts are central to
label: BODY

text: investor confidence in Thailand's emerging securities market have
label: BODY

text: approached the Association for Investment Management and Research
label: BODY

text: (AIMR), an American not-for profit organization of 20,000 investment
label: BODY

text: professionals, to assist in establishing an educational program for financial
label: BODY

text: analysts in Thailand. The program which is managed by the Institute of
label: BODY

text: Certified {financial Analysts (ICFA) of the AIMR aims at the development,
label: H4

text: examination and certification of a level of knowledge prescribed for high
label: H4

text: educational standards in the application of the investment decision making
label: H4

text: process. The Securities Analysts Association (SAA) of Thailand with
label: BODY

text: assistance from USAID will enter Into an agreement with AIMR/ICFA to
label: BODY

text: develop a three level certification process. Candidates who pass the level IH
label: BODY

text: examination will receive the coveted Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA)
label: BODY

text: designation. The ICFA will assist in curriculum design, candidate
label: BODY

text: preparation, examinations, examination grading, initial staffing and study
label: BODY

text: materials.
label: BODY

text: ** Stock Exchange of Thailand Technical Exchange Program With
label: BODY

text: The New York Stock Exchange And Other U.S. Financial Institutions
label: BODY

text: The management of the Stock Exchange of Thailand (SET) has requested
label: H4

text: USAID assistance in establishing a program of technical exchange with the
label: BODY

text: New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) and other U.S. securities industry
label: BODY

text: institutions. The SET until the Gulf conflict was among the fastest growing
label: BODY

text: exchanges in the world. The next boom cycle will outstrip the SET'S capacity
label: BODY

text: to handle share and other transactions. The SET has requested assistance in
label: BODY

text: modernization of its clearance, settlements and custody of securities
label: H4

text: procedures.
label: BODY

text: As a self regulated market, like the NYSE, the SET would like a technical
label: BODY

text: exchange with the NYSE on trading surveillance and market regulation. Also
label: BODY

text: the SET would like assistance to plan for sophisticated risk management tools
label: BODY

text: such as futures contracts.
label: BODY

text: *+ Privatization Fund
label: BODY

text: USA1D in conjunction with APRE/I has initiated discussions with the
label: H4

text: Industrial Finance Corporation of Thailand (IFCT) to establish a
label: H4

text: Privatization Fund (Development Facility of Thailand). The Fund would
label: BODY

text: provide guarantees for up to 50 percent of the financing of privatization'
label: H4

text: projects in Thailand. Projects eligible for access to the facility would range
label: BODY

text: from divestiture of all or part of a state owned enterprise to start up of a
label: BODY

text: private enterprise in an area of activity generally undertaken by the public
label: BODY

text: sector in the past. The Fund may complement other transactions such as the
label: BODY

text: Chiang Mai and Phuket solid waste management projects that USAID is
label: BODY

text: developing with local governments. These activities would in principle be
label: BODY

text: eligible for finance from the fund.
label: BODY

text: ** Asset Management
label: BODY

text: Professional asset management of pooled funds in Thailand is constrained by
label: BODY

text: RTG regulations and inexperienced asset managers. Two transactions will
label: BODY

text: start the process of relaxing regulatory constraints and providing an
label: BODY

text: opportunity for bringing experienced professional asset .management to bear
label: BODY

text: on pooled funds in Thailand. The first transaction is a study that will be
label: BODY

text: undertaken with the Industrial Finance Corporation of Thailand (IFCT) and
label: BODY

text: a US. asset management firm to identify pooled funds; examine legal and
label: BODY

text: regulatory restrictions on how the funds are invested; analyze present
label: BODY

text: management of pooled funds; and recommend changes that would-improve
label: BODY

text: returns on investment of pooled funds.
label: BODY

text: The second transaction is a longer term technical assistance program that
label: BODY

text: would help the tripartite committee (labor, employers and government) that
label: BODY

text: has been tasked to plan and implement Thailand's new national social
label: BODY

text: insurance scheme to formulate and implement an asset management program
label: BODY

text: for the funds generated by the new program. The technical expertise would
label: BODY

text: be drawn from among U.S. professional managers of state pension funds,
label: BODY

text: state government staff responsible for the funds and technical experts that
label: BODY

text: advise them on actuarial and legal aspects of managing the funds.
label: BODY

text: ** Investment Banking pnd Infrastructure Finance
label: BODY

text: Development of active primary and secondary markets for long term debt
label: H4

text: instruments has been identified as the highest priority for Thai financial
label: BODY

text: markets in the 1990s. A number of mega transactions are underway with
label: BODY

text: which US AID has had contact through exploration of possible US AID
label: BODY

text: participation in feasibility studies and/or training. An outgrowth of these
label: BODY

text: explorations has been preliminary discussions with U.S. participants about
label: H4

text: the possibility of raising some of the funds required for the investments
label: H4

text: through issuing bonds. The bond issues would be facilitated by working with
label: BODY

text: RTG committees tasked with bond market development. U.S. companies that
label: BODY

text: might be interested are AT&T, Fluor Daniel, Bechtel, and Black and Veatch;
label: BODY

text: among the projects are $6 billion contract for installation of 3 million
label: BODY

text: telephone lines; contracts for $800 million of waste water treatment facilities
label: BODY

text: in Bangkok, contracts for 12 private cogeneration facilities of up to 300
label: BODY

text: megawatts each.
label: BODY

text: SPECIAL, WORKING GROUPS -I/
label: BODY

text: ** Chiaog Mai and Phukct Solid Waste Management Double digit growth
label: BODY

text: has resulted in environmental problems that are particularly severe in tourist
label: BODY

text: destinations. Pollution in Chiang Mai and Phuket have threatened their
label: BODY

text: respective cultural and natural resource bases which have fueled rapid
label: BODY

text: development. Both municipalities cite solid waste collection and disposal as
label: BODY

text: their number one environmental problem and quickly concede that they
label: BODY

text: cannot sustain growth without addressing this problem. Both municipalities
label: BODY

text: also look to the private sector to replace their inadequate municipal services
label: BODY

text: and greatly respect American technologies and management Initial
label: BODY

text: investment could range from $10.0 to $20.0 million. Given this opportunity,
label: BODY

text: USAID will: (a) provide technical assistance to both cities to develop action
label: BODY

text: plans, prepare tender documents and evaluate responses, and develop
label: BODY

text: revenue streams following the "polluter pays" principle; and (b) ensure
label: BODY

text: maximum US private sector participation in the competitive selection process.
label: BODY

text: ** Bangkok Waste Water Treatment With over 8 million people, Bangkok
label: BODY

text: is one of the world's largest cities without a sewerage system. Rapid economic
label: BODY

text: growth and intensified land use have made traditional disposal methods
label: BODY

text: unreliable and created unsustainable environmental conditions. Yet the costs
label: BODY

text: of building a sewerage system from scratch are immense. A USAID study
label: BODY

text: suggested private financing for and operation of waste water collection aud
label: BODY

text: treatment systems. The government has accepted this and is now in the
label: BODY

text: process of soliciting private interest in constructing and operating a system
label: BODY

text: for 220 sq. km. of the inner city with a population of 2.6 million and an
label: BODY

text: estimated capital cost of $800 million. Given this opportunity USAID will
label: BODY

text: follow a similar approach to municipal solid waste management in providing
label: BODY

text: technical services to the Bangkok municipality to prepare and evaluate tender
label: BODY

text: documents and ensure maximum US private sector participation iiTthe
label: BODY

text: process of selecting a concessionaire.
label: BODY

text: c .
label: BODY

text: I I 't
label: BODY

text: ** Private Power Rapid industrialization, tourism growth and
label: BODY

text: modernization have placed great demands on the electricity supply in
label: BODY

text: Thailand. EGAT, the state-owned electricity generating authority, which had
label: BODY

text: a comfortable reserve margin just a few years ago, now strains to keep up
label: BODY

text: with demand. The government cap on foreign borrowings cannot
label: BODY

text: accommodate the estimated $1 billion annual capital costs of new generating
label: BODY

text: capacity. Consequently, private solutions have been explored, with USAID
label: BODY

text: support. In the first major breakthrough, the government has agreed to
label: BODY

text: allow private firms to cogenerate and sell private power. In the first such
label: BODY

text: instance, a 250 MW plant costing $250 million, will be erected and all three
label: BODY

text: firms in the bidding have US management or ownership. USAID assistance
label: BODY

text: will now focus on: (a) cost sharing feasibility studies for American private
label: BODY

text: power investors; and (b) supporting efforts by EGAT to consider other means
label: BODY

text: to private operations.
label: BODY

text: I/ Suspension of the USAID program following the February 23 military
label: H4

text: coup is giving our industrial competitors an opportunity to improve their
label: BODY

text: strategic positions in Thailand. The Germans (at the behest of their private
label: BODY

text: sector) may step in to assist Bangkok municipality with the private waste
label: BODY

text: water project The Swedes are financing a privatization management audit
label: BODY

text: for EGAT   a study USAID was asked to support And the Japanese and
label: BODY

text: Taiwanese remain interested in solid waste disposal for Chiang Mai.
